snippet: “Could You Please Look Into the Camera,” which was staged last month at the Sunflower Theater in Beirut, Lebanon, examines the Syrian uprising.
abstract: Could You Please Look Into the Camera, by Syrian playwright Mohammad al-Attar, which was staged in May at the Sunflower Theater in Beirut, Lebanon, examines the Syrian uprising; there was only one performance of the play, which aired accusations of torture and other abuse by Pres Bashar al-Assad’s government in Beirut, where a small clandestine community of Syrian activists lives in dread of the long arm of his secret police.
lead_paragraph: “Could You Please Look Into the Camera,” which was staged last month at the Sunflower Theater in Beirut, Lebanon, examines the Syrian uprising.
